HOUSTON PIPE LINE COMPANY LP
FERC NGPA GAS TARIFF
STATEMENT OF OPERATING CONDITIONS (BAMMEL STORAGE RESERVOIR)
EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2010
BASE LINE TARIFF FILING
OPTION CODE "A"

SERVICES ARTICLE 8. NOMINATION PROCEDURES ARTICLE 9. PRIORITY AND INTERRUPTION OF SERVICE ARTICLE 10. ACTUAL ALLOCATION OF MEASURED VOLUMES ARTICLE 11. IMBALANCES ARTICLE 12. MEASUREMENT AND FACILITIES ARTICLE 13. QUALITY ARTICLE 14. TITLE TO GAS, POSSESSION, CONTROL, WARRANTIES ARTICLE 15. BILLING AND PAYMENT ARTICLE 16. CORRESPONDENCE ARTICLE 17. ASSIGNMENT ARTICLE 18. DEFAULT ARTICLE 19. APPLICABLE LAW ARTICLE 20. CONDITIONS PRECEDENT ARTICLE 21. FORCE MAJEURE ARTICLE 22. TERM ARTICLE 23. GAS TO BE WITHDRAWN UPON TERMINATION ARTICLE 24. INDEMNIFICATION ARTICLE 25. GOVERNMENT REGULATION ARTICLE 26. MISCELLANEOUS
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA BEFORE THE FEDERAL ENERGY REGULATORY COMMISSION
HOUSTON PIPE LINE COMPANY LP BAMMEL STORAGE RESERVOIR
STATEMENT OF OPERATING TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR SERVICES RENDERED PURSUANT TO SECTION 311 OF THE NATURAL GAS POLICY ACT OF 1978 AND THE RULES AND REGULATIONS ADOPTED THEREUNDER
THIS STATEMENT OF OPERATING TERMS AND CONDITIONS AND ANY SERVICE AGREEMENT ARE SUBJECT TO ARBITRATION UNDER THE TEXAS GENERAL ARBITRATION ACT
This statement by Houston Pipe Line Company LP ("HPL"), an intrastate pipeline with the meaning of Section 2(16) of the Natural Gas Policy Act of 1978 ("NGPA") is filed pursuant to Section 284.123(e) of the regulations of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission ("FERC") and describes the general provisions under which HPL will provide at the Bammel Storage Facilities firm storage and interruptible storage services to eligible customers qualified to receive such services pursuant to NGPA ? 311(a)(2), as implemented by Part 284, Subpart C of the FERC's regulations. 18 C.F.R. Part 284. HPL has elected to provide its firm and interruptible NGPA ? 311(a)(2) storage services utilizing rates approved by FERC pursuant to Section 284.123(b)(2)(i) of its regulations. FERC has approved market-based rates for these services. This statement shall hereinafter be referred to as the "Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions."
GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS
ARTICLE 1. DEFINITIONS
The following terms used in these General Terms and Conditions shall have the meanings hereinafter set forth:
1.1. Available Capacity means the quantitative amount of service HPL is capable of providing at the Bammel Storage Facilities any time, as determined by HPL in its sole discretion.
1.2. Btu means British Thermal Unit and "MMBtu" means one million (1,000,000) Btus.
1.3. Business Day means any Day, except Saturdays, Sundays, and bank holidays.
1.4. Calendar Year means a period of three hundred sixty-five (365) consecutive days commencing and ending at 9:00 A.M. Central Prevailing Time ("CT"), provided that any year which contains that date of February 29 shall consist of three hundred sixty-six (366) days.
1.5. Capacity Reservation Fee means the fee paid by Customer to HPL for the purpose of reserving capacity in the Storage Facilities.
1.6. Customer means the Party that has executed a Service Agreement with HPL and holds all lawful rights and title to the natural gas that is being stored at HPL's Storage Facilities.
1.7. Day means a period of twenty-four (24) consecutive hours, beginning at 9:00 A.M. CT, on any calendar day and ending at 9:00 A.M. CT, on the following calendar day.
1.8. Deliverability Reservation Fee means the fee paid by Customer to HPL for the purpose of reserving withdrawal capacity from the Storage Facilities.
1.9. Delivery Point(s) means the point or points at which Gas is delivered by HPL to Customer for the account of Customer under an executed Service Agreement providing for Storage Service.
1.10. Extended Term shall have the meaning given to it in Section 7.2.3.3.
1.11. Firm Basis with respect to any service means that the use or partial use of the facilities and/or capacity required to perform the service is reserved for a Customer and, subject to the curtailment provisions of Article 9 is not subject to any other claim by another person.
1.12. Firm Storage Services means any injection, storage, withdrawal and associated transportation services provided by HPL on a Firm Basis at the Facilities.
1.13. Force Majeure shall have the meaning ascribed in Article 23.
1.14. Fuel means the quantity of Gas that HPL shall receive as payment for fuel and loss, if any, associated with the operation of the Facility.
1.15. Gas means merchantable natural gas that meets or exceeds the specifications set forth in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and any Service Agreement.
1.16. Gross Heating Value means the total calorific value expressed in Btus per cubic foot obtained by the complete combustion at constant pressure of the amount of Gas which occupies a volume of one (1) cubic foot at a temperature of sixty degrees (60?) Fahrenheit when saturated with water vapor and with air of the same temperature and pressure as the Gas when the products of combustion are cooled to the initial temperature of the Gas and air when the water formed by combustion is condensed to the liquid state.
1.17. Interruptible Basis or Interruptible means that the service is subject to interruption at any time by HPL in order to accommodate the use of the Facilities, or any part thereof, by (i) any Customer contracting for service on a Firm Basis, (ii) HPL for any reason in its sole discretion, or (iii) any interruptible Customer with a higher priority.
1.18. Interruptible Service means any service set forth in Article 7.3.4. of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions that HPL performs on an Interruptible Basis.
1.19. Maximum Daily Injection Quantity ("MDIQ") means the maximum quantity of gas which HPL is obligated to receive into the Facility for the account of Customer during one Day at an uniform hourly rate over the course of such Day or as specified in an executed Service Agreement providing for Firm Storage Service between Customer and HPL. Total MDIQ shall include Working Gas plus Fuel.
1.20. Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity ("MDWQ") means the maximum quantity of gas which HPL is obligated to deliver for the account of Customer during one Day at an uniform hourly rate over the course of such Day or as specified in an executed Service Agreement providing for Firm Storage Service between Customer and HPL.
1.21. Maximum Storage Quantity ("MSQ") means the maximum quantity of gas which HPL is obligated to store at any one time for the account of Customer as specified in an executed Service Agreement providing for Firm Storage Service between Customer and HPL.
1.22. Mcf means one thousand (1,000) cubic feet of Gas as determined on the measurement basis set forth in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions.
1.23. Month means a period beginning at 9:00 A.M. CT on the first Day of a calendar Month and ending at the same hour on the first Day of the succeeding calendar Month.
1.24. Operational Balancing Agreement(s) ("OBA") means an agreement(s) between HPL and an upstream or downstream operator at a Receipt or Delivery Point(s) whereby the variance of actual measured gas and confirmed gas at a particular Receipt or Delivery Point(s) is resolved between HPL and the upstream or downstream operator under the terms of the OBA.
1.25. Operator means any legal entity that owns natural gas production, or owns and/or operates gas production, processing or upstream or downstream pipeline facilities, which are directly connected to HPL's Facilities, and who is responsible for the confirmation and scheduling of receipt or delivery quantities, and the allocation of gas through such interconnecting facility.
1.26. Party or Parties means or refers to HPL and/or Customer individually or collectively as the case may be.
1.27. Potential Customer shall mean any person that desires to execute a Service Agreement with HPL.
1.28. Psia means pounds per square inch absolute.
1.29. Psig means pounds per square inch gauge.
1.30. Receipt Point(s) means the point or points at which Gas is received into the Facilities by HPL for the account of Customer under an executed Service Agreement providing for Storage Service.
1.31. Service Agreement means an effective and unexpired executed agreement between HPL and Customer providing for service by HPL on a Firm Basis or Interruptible Basis pursuant to such Service Agreement.
1.32. Storage Facilities, Facilities, Bammel Storage Facilities or Facility mean the Bammel Storage Reservoir located in Harris County, Texas that is operated by HPL. The underground Bammel Storage Reservoir and related transportation assets include the approximately 7,000-acre underground Bammel Storage Reservoir, together with injection wells, withdrawal wells and other facilities relative thereto, and cushion gas in the reservoir that is used to maintain geological structural integrity and to provide necessary pressure to withdraw working gas for sale and transport.
1.33. Storage Inventory means the quantity of working gas in MMBtus, that a Customer has in place in the Bammel Storage Facilities for Customer's account, provided that the Storage Inventory shall never exceed Customer's Maximum Storage Quantity.
1.34. Storage Service includes, but is not limited to, one or a combination of more than one of the following services rendered by HPL for the account of a Customer under an executed Service Agreement providing for Storage Service: Firm and Interruptible Storage, and Interruptible Loan.
1.35. Transporter means the Customer's transporter designated to deliver gas to the Receipt Points or Customer's transporter designated to receive gas at the Delivery Points.
1.36. Working Gas means the Gas which is injected into the Storage Facilities by HPL for its own account, for the account of Customer pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Service Agreement, or for the account of others.
ARTICLE 2. AVAILABILITY
2.1. HPL operates the Storage Facilities. Its primary business is to serve its storage markets within the State of Texas. HPL will provide Firm Storage and Interruptible Services on behalf of Customers that are qualified to receive such service under NGPA ? 311(a)(2), without undue discrimination or preference within the meaning of 18 C.F.R. ? 284.7(b)(1), subject to:
2.1.1. the conditions set forth in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions;
2.1.2. such other reasonable conditions as may be established from time to time by HPL pursuant to 18 C.F.R. ? 284.123(e);
2.1.3. applicable legal and regulatory requirements; and
2.1.4. the execution of a Service Agreement and the terms and conditions contained in such Service Agreement.
ARTICLE 3. REQUEST FOR SERVICE
3.1. Requests for Service. Any Potential Customer wishing to obtain Firm Storage Service or Interruptible Service from HPL shall submit, orally or in writing, a request for service to HPL, which shall include the information specified in Articles 3.2 and 3.3. Such request may be made orally by phone, delivered in person or submitted by United States mail, overnight courier service, e-mail or facsimile transmission (fax). HPL shall evaluate and respond to Potential Customer's request within a reasonable time of its receipt, but no later than fifteen (15) Business Days of its receipt. A Potential Customer's request for service shall be considered complete only if the information specified in Article 3.2 and Article 3.3 is provided.
3.2. Information Requirements. Each request shall include the following information:
3.2.1. The Potential Customer's name, address, representative and telephone number.
3.2.2. A statement of whether Potential Customer is a local natural gas distribution company (LDC), an intrastate pipeline company, an interstate pipeline company, marketer/broker, producer, end user or other type of entity (which other entity must be described) and the "on behalf of" entity(ies) that are warranted by Customer to meet the provisions of Part 284 of the FERC's regulations.
3.2.3. Volume and type of service requested, whether Firm Storage Service or Interruptible Service, and, if the latter, the particular Interruptible Service requested.
3.2.4. If Firm Storage Service is requested, each of the following:
3.2.4.1. Maximum Storage Quantity (stated in MMBtus);
3.2.4.2. Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity (stated in MMBtus/Day) and at which Delivery Point(s); and
3.2.4.3. Maximum Daily Injection Quantity (stated in MMBtu/Day) and at which Receipt Point(s).
3.2.5. Term of service, including the date service is requested to commence and the date service is requested to terminate.
3.3. Evidence of creditworthiness. HPL's agreement to execute a Service Agreement or to engage in a specific transaction for Firm Storage Service or Interruptible Service under a Service Agreement is contingent upon a satisfactory appraisal of Potential Customer's credit by HPL. To enable HPL to conduct such credit appraisal, the Potential Customer must submit the information set out in subsections 3.3.1 below; provided, however, that submission of such material shall not be deemed acceptance of the Request for Service Agreement. HPL will apply consistent evaluation practices on a non-discriminatory basis to determine creditworthiness.
3.3.1 Whenever requested by HPL, Potential Customer must provide: (a) a copy of its last two (2) fiscal years of audited financial statements, including balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement and accompanying footnotes; (b) a bank reference; and (c) at least three trade references, which indicate that Potential Customer's obligations with third parties are being paid on a prompt basis. If Potential Customer cannot provide the above information on itself, then Potential Customer must, if applicable, provide that information for its parent company.
3.3.2 In the event HPL determines Potential Customer's or Customer's credit to be unsatisfactory in HPL's sole opinion, as tested in a commercially reasonable manner, at any time during the term of any Service Agreement, then Potential Customer or Customer shall comply with the provisions of sections 16.3 and 16.4 hereof.
3.4. Customer Representations: Customer shall represent and warrant to HPL, which representations and warranties shall continue throughout the term of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and any Service Agreement, the following:
(a) there are no suits, proceedings, judgments, rulings or orders by or before any court or any governmental authority that materially and adversely affect its ability to perform this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and any Service Agreement or the rights of the other Party under this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and any Service Agreement;
(b) it is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction of its formation, and it has the legal right, power and authority and is qualified to conduct its business, and to execute and deliver this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and any Service Agreement and perform its obligations under the same, and all regulatory authorizations have been maintained as necessary for it to legally perform its obligations hereunder;
(c) the making of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and any Service Agreement and performance by it hereunder is within its powers, has been duly authorized by all necessary action on its part, and does not and will not violate any provision of law or any rule, regulation, order, writ, judgment, decree or other determination presently in effect applicable to it or its governing documents;
(d) this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and any Service Agreement when entered into constitutes a legal, valid and binding act and obligation of it, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms, subject to bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization and other laws affecting creditor's rights generally, and with regard to equitable remedies, to the discretion of the court before which proceedings to obtain same may be pending;
(e) there are no bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, receivership or other arrangement proceedings pending or being contemplated by it, or to its knowledge threatened against it;
(f) it has assets of $5,000,000 or more according to its most recent financial statements prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, consistently applied, and is knowledgeable and experienced in financial matters that enable it to evaluate the merits and risks of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and any Service Agreement; and
(g) it is not in a disparate bargaining position with HPL.
3.5. Subsequent Information.
3.5.1. After receipt of a request for service, HPL may require that a Potential Customer furnish additional information as a prerequisite to HPL offering to execute a Service Agreement with the Potential Customer. Such information may include proof of the Potential Customer's lawful right and title to cause the Gas to be delivered to HPL for storage or other services and of the Potential Customer's contractual or physical ability to cause such Gas to be delivered to and received from HPL.
3.5.2. Request Validity. If HPL has tendered a Service Agreement for execution to a Potential Customer and Potential Customer fails to execute the Service Agreement as tendered within five (5) Days from the date the Service Agreement has been tendered by HPL, HPL may consider Potential Customer's service request void. For Firm Basis service, HPL will not be required to tender a Service Agreement to a Potential Customer for execution that relates to requests for service for which HPL does not have sufficient available capacity or injection or withdrawal capabilities.. Any such refusal by HPL will be on a non-discriminatory basis.
3.5.3. Customer or Potential Customer is required to provide to HPL (1) the state of the consumption of Gas that is to be withdrawn from storage or that will be the subject of other services by HPL and (2) such other information if required in order for HPL to comply with any FERC reporting or other requirements.
3.5.4. Complaints. In the event that a Customer or Potential Customer has a complaint relative to Firm Storage Service or Interruptible Service, the Customer or Potential Customer shall provide a description of the complaint, verbally or in writing, including the identification of the service request (if applicable), and communicate it to:
Houston Pipe Line Company LP 711 Louisiana St., Suite 900 Houston, Texas 77002 Attn: Storage Services Fax No.: 832/668-1119 Phone No.: 832/668-1000
HPL will verbally respond initially within a reasonable time, but no later than fifteen (15) Business Days, from the day of receipt of a complaint. HPL shall respond in writing within sixty (60) Days of receipt of the complaint advising Customer or Potential Customer of the disposition of the complaint.
3.6 HPL shall have the right to reject any request for Service Agreement that does not contain the required information set forth herein and HPL will have no liability to Customer or any other entity in connection with such rejection.
3.7 Service Agreements. After Customer has requested a Service Agreement and after HPL has determined that Customer is creditworthy, HPL and Customer will enter into a Service Agreement, which will incorporate by reference the provisions of this Statement of Operating Conditions. Multiple arrangements can be agreed to between the parties and confirmed by separate Service Agreement(s). Neither HPL nor Customer will have any obligations to one another until authorized representatives of both HPL and Customer have executed a Service Agreement. Any applicable Service Agreement will contain specific details agreed to by HPL and Customer for a particular service arrangement.
3.8. Information.
3.8.1. Any person may request information by contacting HPL at the following:
Houston Pipe Line Company LP 711 Louisiana St., Suite 900 Houston, Texas 77002 Attn: Storage Services Fax No.: 832/668-1119 Phone No.: 832/668-1000
3.8.2. Each Customer will be provided with a list of phone numbers for HPL dispatch and control personnel who are on-call 24-hours a Day.
3.8.3. Each Customer will provide to HPL a list of phone numbers of Customer's personnel who will be available, including those on a 24-hours a Day basis.
ARTICLE 4. RECEIPT AND DELIVERY OF GAS
4.1. Subject to HPL's own operating requirements, the availability of capacity in its Storage Facilities not required for its own use from time to time, and the availability of capacity sufficient to provide the service on a Firm or Interruptible Basis, as applicable, certain designated quantities of Gas will be received for Customer's account at mutually agreeable Receipt Point(s) and certain designated quantities will be delivered to Customer or its designee at mutually agreeable Delivery Point(s), including delivery into storage. It is specifically understood that it is Customer's sole obligation to furnish the Gas received by HPL under a Service Agreement and, unless otherwise agreed pursuant to a particular service that HPL has agreed to perform as set out in Customer's Service Agreement, HPL shall have no obligation whatsoever to deliver at the Delivery Point(s) or otherwise make quantities of Gas available to Customer on any Day or hour thereof in excess of the quantity received by HPL under such Service Agreement at a Receipt Point(s).
ARTICLE 5. RECEIPT AND DELIVERY PRESSURE
5.1. HPL shall deliver gas to Customer at such pressures as may exist from time to time in HPL's facilities at the Delivery Point(s). Customer shall deliver or cause to be delivered to HPL all gas specified in Customer's Service Agreement at the Receipt Point(s) at pressures established between HPL and an upstream or downstream operator and not in excess of the MAOP of HPL's Facilities at the Receipt Point(s). HPL or its designee shall be responsible for maintaining facilities at such Receipt Point(s) to permit Customer to deliver gas to HPL at such allowed pressures. Except as may be otherwise provided in any applicable Service Agreement, HPL shall not be obligated to provide compression or alter pipeline operations to effectuate the receipt or delivery of gas at such points. In the event that HPL agrees to provide compression in a Service Agreement to effectuate the delivery of gas at a Delivery Point(s), then Customer shall reimburse or pay to HPL for any and all costs that may be incurred by HPL to effectuate such delivery of gas.
ARTICLE 6. SERVICE CHARGES
6.1. Customer shall pay or reimburse HPL, as the case may be, any and all ad valorem, production, severance, gross receipts, sales, occupation, production, gathering, compression, sales, gross receipts or other taxes (excluding income taxes) levied, assessed or fixed by any authority against HPL in connection with or attributable to Customer's gas or in respect of services provided by HPL pursuant to this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions. Should any new tax or any increase in the rate of the aforesaid taxes be imposed on HPL, the Bammel Storage Facilities or on a transaction under which HPL provides firm storage or interruptible services to Customer during the term of Customer's Service Agreement, then Customer agrees to reimburse HPL one hundred percent (100%) of such new taxes or increase in the rate of the aforesaid taxes actually paid by HPL.
ARTICLE 7. SERVICES
7.1. Customer shall be permitted to combine Firm Storage Service with one or more Interruptible Services available under this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions or to combine two or more Interruptible Services available under this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions; provided, however, such combined services shall be subject to Article 9, Priority, Interruption of Service and Operational Flow Orders, and provided further that the priority for each service shall be determined by the respective priority of that service as set forth in Article 9.
7.2. Firm Storage Service.
7.2.1. Character, Availability and Conditions of Firm Storage Service.
7.2.1.1. Subject to the terms of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Customer's Service Agreement, HPL shall provide storage service on a Firm Basis at the Storage Facilities for Customer, which service shall include the reservation of capacity in the Storage Facilities, on a Firm Basis, for Customer sufficient to enable Customer to inject gas into, withdraw gas from, and store gas in the Storage Facilities, in quantities up to the maximum quantities set forth in Customer's Service Agreement. HPL shall perform these Services on a basis that is not unduly discriminatory.
7.2.1.2. Firm service shall be provided when, and to the extent that HPL in its sole discretion determines that capacity is available.
7.2.1.3. Firm Storage Services shall consist of the receipt of gas at the Receipt Point(s) up to Customer's Maximum Daily Injection Quantity ("MDIQ"), the storage of gas not to exceed Customer's Maximum Storage Quantity ("MSQ"), and the tender for redelivery by HPL to Customer at the Delivery Point(s) up to Customer's Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity ("MDWQ").
7.2.1.4. Notwithstanding anything in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions or any applicable Service Agreement to the contrary, HPL shall not in any event whatsoever be obligated to receive or deliver for Customer's account quantities of Working Gas in excess of (i) Customer's MDIQ or MDWQ, respectively, or (ii) Customer's MSQ.
7.2.1.5. HPL will schedule Gas at Receipt Point(s) on a Firm Basis pursuant to Customer's nomination and the other provisions of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions. Receipt Point(s) will be specified in Customer's Service Agreement. Each Customer's MDIQ under the Service Agreement must be allocated among the Receipt Point(s) such that the MDIQ equals the sum of the individual maximum daily quantities for Receipt Point(s).
7.2.1.6. HPL will schedule Gas at Delivery Point(s) on a Firm Basis pursuant to Customer's nomination and the other provisions of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions. Delivery Point(s) will be specified in Customer's Service Agreement. Each Customer's MDWQ under the Service Agreement must be allocated among the Delivery Point(s) such that the MDWQ equals the sum of the individual maximum daily quantities for Delivery Point(s).
7.2.1.7. Customer will be responsible for making all necessary transportation arrangements into and away from the Storage Facilities, including without limitation, nomination and scheduling of Gas with pipeline transporters in quantities necessary for the performance of the Firm Storage Service provided under this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Customer's Service Agreement. All receipts and deliveries of Gas shall be at a uniform hourly rate of flow over the course of the Day not to exceed 1/24th of Customer's scheduled daily volume at an instantaneous standard volumetric flow rate at any point in time during the hour, unless otherwise agreed.
7.2.2. Firm Storage Services Charges.
7.2.2 .1. A Firm Storage Service Customer shall pay HPL the following charges that are set forth in Customer's individually-negotiated Service Agreement and any other charges negotiated by the Parties:
A charge for injection which is the product of the Injection Fee set forth in Customer's Service Agreement times the quantities of Working Gas, measured in MMBtus, received at the Receipt Point(s) and injected into the Storage Facilities for the account of Customer during such Month.
A charge for withdrawal and delivery which is the product of the Withdrawal Fee set forth in Customer's Service Agreement times the quantities of Working Gas, measured in MMBtus, withdrawn from the Storage Facilities and redelivered for the account of Customer at the Delivery Point(s) during such Month.
A monthly capacity reservation charge which is the product of the Capacity Reservation Fee, as set forth in Customer's Service Agreement, times Customer's Maximum Storage Quantity, expressed in MMBtus.
A monthly deliverability reservation charge which is the product of the Deliverability Reservation Fee, as set forth in Customer's Service Agreement, times Customer's Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity, expressed in MMBtus.
7.2.2.2. A Firm Storage Service Customer shall also pay HPL monthly the following additional charges as set forth in Customer's individually negotiated Service Agreement:
A charge for fuel and loss consisting of a quantity of Gas, measured in MMBtus, equal to the Injection Fuel Percentage, as set forth in Customer's Service Agreement(s) times the gross quantities of Gas tendered at the Receipt Point(s) for injection into the Storage Facilities for the account of Customer during such Month. The net quantity of Working Gas to be injected for Customer's account shall be determined by multiplying the result of 1 minus Injection the Fuel Percentage, times the gross quantity of Gas delivered by Customer at the downstream flange of inlet meter at the Storage Facilities.
A charge for fuel and loss consisting of a quantity of Gas, measured in MMBtus, equal to the Withdrawal Fuel Percentage, as set forth in Customer's Service Agreement(s) times the gross quantities of Gas withdrawn from the Storage Facilities for the account of Customer and tendered at the Delivery Point(s) during such Month. The net quantity of Working Gas to be withdrawn from Customer's account shall be determined by multiplying the result of 1 minus the Withdrawal Fuel Percentage, times the gross quantity of Gas delivered by HPL for the account of Customer at the downstream flange of withdrawal meter at the Storage Facilities.
This fuel quantity of Gas and title thereto shall transfer to HPL at the downstream flange of HPL's meter at the Storage Facilities.
All penalties, if any, and other charges described in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions, to the extent applicable to any Firm Storage Service.
7.2.2.3. Each and every injection and/or delivery for Customer's account shall constitute a separate Storage Service rendered for Customer's account and Customer's account will be charged accordingly.
7.2.3 Injection And Delivery Procedures.
7.2.3.1. HPL shall receive from Customer at the Customer's Receipt Point(s) properly nominated Working Gas for injection plus Fuel up to Customer's MDIQ; provided, however, that HPL shall not be obligated to receive and inject into the Storage Facilities on any Day any quantities of Gas greater than the difference between Customer's Maximum Storage Quantity and the balance of Working Gas Customer has in Storage at that time; and provided, further, that Customer's MDIQ may be less from time to time depending upon the amount of Gas and operational pressures existing from time to time in the Storage Facilities and at the Receipt Point(s). HPL's obligation to receive Gas for injection into the Storage Facilities shall be subject to all provisions of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Customer's Service Agreement.
7.2.3.2. HPL shall deliver to Customer properly nominated Working Gas from the Storage Facilities at the Delivery Point(s) up to the MDWQ, provided, HPL is not obligated at any time to deliver any quantity of Gas to Customer in excess of the balance of Working Gas that Customer has in Storage at that time. HPL's obligation to deliver quantities of Working Gas up to the MDWQ shall be subject to all provisions of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Customer's Service Agreement.
7.2.3.3. If upon expiration of Customer's Service Agreement, quantities of Customer's Working Gas remain in the Storage Facilities for any reason other than HPL's failure to make properly nominated quantities available for delivery, then HPL shall have the option, to be exercised within five (5) Business Days after expiration of Customer's Service Agreement, in its sole discretion, to either (i) extend the term of Customer's Service Agreement for an extended term to the next available withdrawal cycle ("Extended Term") during which Customer shall, under conditions of delivery determined by HPL, properly nominate and accept deliveries at the Delivery Point(s) from the Storage Facilities of all of its remaining Working Gas at a charge equal to $2.00 times the Working Gas balance remaining in the Storage Facilities or other mutually agreeable rates, or (ii) purchase each MMBtu of Customer's Working Gas balance remaining in the Storage Facilities at a price per MMBtu equal to the lowest of (A) the Platts (A Division of The McGraw-Hill Companies, Inc.) Monthly Inside FERC published index price for East Texas, Houston Ship Channel, Katy Market Center location (IFHSC) less $0.15 for the month following the expiration of Customer's Service Agreement or (B) the IFHSC index posting for the month in which the Service Agreement expired less $0.15 or (C) the lowest Gas Daily Midpoint Price stated in Gas Daily(r) (Platts, a division of The McGraw-Hill Companies, Inc.) or successor publication, in the column "Daily Price Survey" for Houston Ship Channel less $0.15 for any day during the next month after expiration of Customer's Service Agreement.
7.2.3.4. Notwithstanding anything in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions or Customer's Service Agreement to the contrary, and in the event HPL elects to extend the term of Customer's Service Agreement as permitted in Article 7.2.3.3. above, if after such extension period, Customer still has Working Gas remaining in the Storage Facilities, title to all said Working Gas remaining in the Storage Facilities shall automatically be transferred to HPL at the expiration of such extension period as compensation for Customer's failure to properly nominate and accept delivery of such Working Gas and Customer will have no further rights with regard thereto. To the extent that the foregoing title transfer provision may be deemed to constitute liquidated damages, the Parties agree that HPL's damages from Customer's failure to nominate and accept delivery of gas, which may include but not be limited to lost opportunity costs, are difficult or impossible to determine and that such title transfer constitutes a reasonable approximation of such damages.
7.2.4. Receipt And Delivery Point(s).
7.2.4.1. The Receipt Point(s) for all gas to be tendered by Customer to HPL for injection into the Storage Facilities shall be as specified in Customer's Service Agreement , and the Maximum Daily Injection Quantity which HPL is obligated to receive from Customer at each individual Receipt Point shall not exceed the maximum stated therein.
7.2.4.2. The Delivery Point(s) for all gas to be tendered by HPL to Customer for delivery pursuant to the terms hereof shall be as specified in Customer's Service Agreement , and the Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity which HPL is obligated to deliver to Customer at each such Delivery Point shall not exceed the maximum stated therein.
7.2.4.3. Allocation at Receipt and Delivery Point(s). It is recognized that quantities of Gas may be received or delivered through the Receipt Point(s) and/or the Delivery Point(s) from one or more Parties other than the Customer. If that occurs, the measurement of gas may involve the allocation of Gas receipts or deliveries.
7.2.4.4. Payment of Fees. Customer must pay any and all injection, storage, withdrawal, transportation, measurement, testing, compression or other fees or charges imposed by any party on deliveries at any Receipt Point(s) or Delivery Point(s). Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event HPL pays any such fees, Customer must reimburse HPL for any such fees or charges paid by HPL with respect to Customer's Gas provided that HPL has given Customer written notice of the amount of such fees and Customer has agreed in writing to reimburse HPL for such fee. If Customer has not given HPL written notice of its agreement to reimburse HPL for any such fees, HPL will have no obligation to receive Gas for Customer at any such Receipt Point(s) or deliver Gas for Customer at any such Delivery Point(s) that may be subject to the fee.
7.3. Interruptible Services.
7.3.1. Availability and Other Conditions Applicable to Interruptible Service.
7.3.1.1. Subject to the terms of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Customer's Service Agreement, HPL shall provide, on an Interruptible Basis at the Storage Facilities for Customer, the services set forth below, as may be requested by Customer and agreed by the Parties. HPL shall perform these Services on a basis that is not unduly discriminatory.
7.3.1.2. Interruptible Services shall be provided when, and to the extent that, HPL determines that capacity is available for such Interruptible Services.
7.3.1.3. HPL retains all rights at any and all times during the term of an executed Service Agreement for Interruptible Services to decrease or temporarily suspend receipt and/or delivery of Gas if such capacity is required to render service of a higher priority, as set forth in Article 9. IF HPL EXERCISES SUCH RIGHTS, CUSTOMER SHALL HOLD HPL HARMLESS FROM ANY LOSS, CLAIM, DAMAGE OR EXPENSE THAT SUCH CUSTOMER OR OTHER PARTY MAY INCUR BY REASON OF SUCH DECREASE OR SUSPENSION.
7.3.1.4. Customer shall be responsible for making all necessary transportation arrangements into and away from the Facilities, including, without limitation, nomination and scheduling of Gas with pipeline transporters in quantities necessary for the performance of Interruptible Services. All receipts and deliveries shall be at a uniform hourly rate of flow over the course of a Day not to exceed 1/24th of Customer's scheduled daily volume at an instantaneous standard volumetric flow rate at any point in time during the hour, unless otherwise mutually agreed to between Customer and HPL and allowed by the connecting pipeline transporters.
7.3.1.5. Interruptible Services may not be available to the extent that HPL would be required to construct, modify, expand or acquire any facilities to enable HPL to perform the requested service.
7.3.1.6. Transaction Requests. Subject to Article 3, Customer may request HPL to provide one or more Interruptible Services by telephone, fax, U.S. mail or electronic bulletin board, if available, and such request shall become a Transaction Request; provided, that HPL is not obligated to accept any Transaction Request. Any such refusal by HPL will be on a non-discriminatory basis. If HPL accepts the Transaction Request, HPL shall provide a Service Agreement for such Interruptible Services to Customer. The execution of such Service Agreement by the Parties shall create a binding agreement between Customer and HPL to perform the requested Interruptible Service(s) under the terms of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and the Service Agreement.
7.3.2. Interruptible Services Charges.
7.3.2.1. Rates for Interruptible Services. An Interruptible Storage Service Customer shall pay HPL the following charges that are set forth in Customer's individually-negotiated Service Agreement(s) and any other charges negotiated by the Parties.
A charge for injection which is the product of the Injection Fee set forth in Customer's Service Agreement times the quantities of Working Gas, measured in MMBtus, received at the Receipt Point(s) and injected into the Storage Facilities for the account of Customer during such Month.
A charge for storage which is the product of the Storage Fee set forth in Customer's Service Agreement times the maximum quantity of working gas in Customer's Gas Storage Inventory Account, in terms of MMBtus, during the month.
A charge for withdrawal and delivery which is the product of the Withdrawal Fee set forth in Customer's Service Agreement times the quantities of Working Gas, measured in MMBtus, withdrawn from the Storage Facilities and redelivered for the account of Customer at the Delivery Point(s) during such Month.
7.3.2.2. Fuel. Subject to applicable maximum charges, the charge for Fuel for Interruptible Services shall be as set forth in the individually-negotiated Service Agreement(s).
A charge for fuel and loss consisting of a quantity of Gas, measured in MMBtus, equal to the Injection Fuel Percentage, as set forth in Customer's Service Agreement times the gross quantities of Gas tendered at the Receipt Point(s) for injection into the Storage Facilities for the account of Customer during such Month. The net quantity of Working Gas to be injected for Customer's account shall be determined by multiplying the result of 1 minus the Injection Fuel Percentage, times the gross quantity of Gas delivered by Customer at the downstream flange of inlet meter at the Storage Facilities.
A charge for fuel and loss consisting of a quantity of Gas, measured in MMBtus, equal to the Withdrawal Fuel Percentage, as set forth in Customer's Service Agreement times the gross quantities of Gas withdrawn from the Storage Facilities for the account of Customer and tendered at the Delivery Point(s) during such Month. The net quantity of Working Gas to be withdrawn from Customer's account shall be determined by multiplying the result of 1 minus the Withdrawal Fuel Percentage, times the gross quantity of Gas delivered by HPL for the account of Customer at the downstream flange of withdrawal meter at the Storage Facilities.
This fuel quantity of Gas and title thereto shall transfer to HPL at the downstream flange of HPL's inlet meter at the Storage Facilities.
All penalties, if any, and other charges described in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions, to the extent applicable to any Firm Storage Service.
7.3.2.3. Penalties and Other Charges. In addition to the rates for Interruptible Services as set forth in Article 7.3.2.1 and 7.3.2.2. above, the penalties and other charges described in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions shall apply according to their terms to any Service Agreement for Interruptible Services.
7.3.3. Receipt Point(s) And Redelivery. The Receipt Point(s) and Delivery Point(s) for each Interruptible Service shall be as specified in Customer's Service Agreement.
7.3.4. Other Available Interruptible Services.
7.3.4.1. Loan Service.
Interruptible Loan Service ("ILS") rendered by HPL to Customer under this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions shall consist of the advancement to Customer of gas on an interruptible basis by HPL. Customer agrees to replace the borrowed quantities of gas to HPL at a time to be agreed upon and consistent with other terms and conditions as set forth in the Service Agreement(s) with Customer.
Rates and Charges. Pursuant to Article 7.3.2., the rates and charges paid by Customer for ILS shall be as set forth in Customer's individually negotiated Service Agreement.
ARTICLE 8. NOMINATION PROCEDURES
8.1. For each Day on which Customer desires Firm Storage Service or one or more Interruptible Services, Customer shall submit to HPL, in writing or via electronic means if such are implemented by HPL, a nomination ("Nomination") for such service in accordance with the following provisions. The Nomination shall include but is not limited to the following information: volume, flow period, upstream transportation contract number(s) (for injections), downstream transportation contract number(s) (for withdrawals), Customer name and contract number, the Customer's authorized employee name and telephone number, the type of service desired, the state of the consumption of Gas.
8.2. Customer shall make available and tender any gas to be injected hereunder and receive and accept delivery, upon tender by HPL, of any gas requested to be withdrawn from storage. Customer's Gas Storage Inventory Account shall be increased or decreased upon injection or withdrawal of Gas from storage, as applicable. Customer shall not (unless otherwise agreed by HPL) tender for injection, nor shall HPL be obligated to receive Gas for injection or to withdraw and deliver Gas from storage, on an hourly basis at rates of flow in excess of 1/24 of Customer's MDIQ or MDWQ, respectively.
8.3. For any service to commence on any Day, Customer shall submit Nominations to HPL no later than 11:30 A.M. CT on the Business Day preceding the Day the desired service is to commence. HPL may require revised Nominations or prospective Nomination changes by Customer if the actual daily flows differ from the confirmed Nomination, or any imbalance has occurred due to some operational reason.
8.4. If Customer desires to make intraday nominations changes, the Customer must first receive permission from HPL before the changes can be made. It will be at HPL's sole discretion to accept an intraday nomination change. In any event, Customer shall notify HPL at least four (4) hours in advance of any requested change in the hourly rate of flow for injections or withdrawals of Gas.
8.5. HPL may waive any part of the four (4) hour notice upon request if, in HPL's sole judgment, operating conditions permit such waiver and Transporter(s) permit such action. Customer shall notify HPL immediately of any circumstance which causes or will cause the deliveries to or receipts from HPL to be different from those requested.
8.6. Notwithstanding the above, a Nomination shall not become effective until such Nomination is confirmed by HPL and the transporting pipeline. HPL will confirm Nominations as soon as reasonably possible after receipt of such and advise Customer of scheduled service and effective time of such service. If Customer fails to nominate deliveries as required herein for any Delivery Point or Receipt Point on any Day, then Customer will be deemed to have nominated zero quantities for such point for that Day.
8.7. Customer's prioritization of nominated quantities shall not be inconsistent with the terms of this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and such prioritization shall be honored to the extent that HPL reasonably determines such prioritization is operationally feasible.
8.8. Notwithstanding the above, no Gas shall flow under any Nomination until HPL has confirmed the Nomination, awarded capacity and scheduled the applicable quantities.
8.9. HPL shall not be obligated to receive any Gas at any Receipt Point(s) or to deliver any Gas at any Delivery Point(s) if such receipt or delivery shall, in HPL's reasonable discretion, be detrimental to the operations of the Facilities.
8.10. HPL reserves the right to change these procedures as it deems necessary at any time. HPL shall provide Customer reasonable notice of such changes.
ARTICLE 9. PRIORITY AND INTERRUPTION OF SERVICE
9.1. Scheduling and Priority of Service. Promptly upon the close of the Nomination period for each Day, HPL will evaluate all timely daily Nominations based upon the prevailing operating conditions, scheduled or unscheduled maintenance or repairs, and any other similar conditions. HPL will then schedule services to the extent capacity is available. Capacity will be allocated, if necessary, pursuant to this Article 9.1, in the following order.
9.1.1. HPL's Gas received or delivered for operational purposes will be scheduled before any service. For purposes of this Article 9.1.1., operational purposes shall mean for purposes of maintaining at the Facilities the operational integrity of the physical system and the preservation of physical assets and their performance (including the capability and performance of the storage reservoir), the overall operating performance of the entire physical system as an entity (or any portion thereof), and the maintenance (on a reliable and operationally sound basis) of total system deliverability and the quality of the gas delivered.
9.1.2. HPL will schedule capacity at Firm Receipt and Firm Delivery Point(s) up to the maximum quantities set forth in the corresponding Service Agreement. If sufficient capacity is not available at a particular Receipt Point or Delivery Point, the point shall be scheduled pro rata.
9.1.3. After HPL schedules Firm Service, if capacity remains, it may be scheduled to Interruptible Services. Interruptible Services shall be subject to and subordinate to Firm services provided by HPL. HPL will schedule Interruptible Services at Receipt and Delivery Point(s) based on economic value and operating conditions, such that customers who provide the highest value to HPL for the service in question will be scheduled before those who provide a lower value. In the event more than one Interruptible Service Customer requests service of an equivalent economic value, then HPL will schedule such Nominations pro rata for the applicable Receipt Point or Delivery Point quantities.
9.2. Interruption.
9.2.1.
9.2.1.1. If on any Day, due to any cause whatsoever, HPL's capability to receive or deliver volumes is impaired so that it, in its sole discretion, determines that it is unable to receive or deliver all the volumes which are scheduled, then interruption of Firm Storage Service shall be made in the order of priority set forth in Article 9.1, where Customers having the lowest priority will be interrupted first.
9.2.1.2. HPL shall provide Customer as much advance notice of any interruption as is practicable under the circumstances. Such notice shall state the reduced volumes of Gas that HPL estimates it will be able to inject or withdraw for Customer and the estimated duration of the interruption.
9.2.2. Interruption Liability. HPL SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS OR DAMAGE TO ANY PERSON OR PROPERTY CAUSED, IN WHOLE OR IN PART, BY ANY INTERRUPTION OR CURTAILMENT OF SERVICE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THIS SECTION. CUSTOMER AGREES TO INDEMNIFY AND HOLD HARMLESS HPL, ITS OFFICERS, MEMBERS, AGENTS, EMPLOYEES AND CONTRACTORS, FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL SUITS, CLAIMS, LIABILITY, LOSS, DAMAGES, COSTS (INCLUDING ATTORNEYS' FEES AND COURT COSTS) OR ENCUMBRANCES WHATSOEVER BROUGHT BY ANY PERSON OR ENTITY AGAINST HPL AS A RESULT OF, OR ARISING OUT OF, SUCH INTERRUPTION OR CURTAILMENT OF SERVICE.
ARTICLE 10. ACTUAL ALLOCATION OF MEASURED VOLUMES
10.1. At the end of each Month, HPL shall allocate the daily quantity of Gas measured at each Receipt Point and each Delivery Point for the accounts of Customers under each Service Agreement. To the extent possible, all quantities of Gas measured at each Receipt Point and each Delivery Point shall be allocated on the basis of Customers' confirmed Nominations. In the event the quantities of Gas measured at any Receipt Point or any Delivery Point do not equal the confirmed Nominations for such point, the quantities of Gas measured at the Receipt Point or the Delivery Point shall be allocated in the following order: (a) under the provisions of an OBA if agreeable to Operator and HPL, (b) on the basis of the method established on HPL's system for purposes of allocating quantities of Gas measured at any Delivery Point(s) or Receipt Point(s), or (c) pro rata.
10.2. HPL may negotiate and execute an OBA with any Operator for the purpose of minimizing operational imbalances or other matters with respect to the receipt of Gas into or the delivery of Gas from the Facilities; provided, however, that HPL and the Operator can mutually agree on all terms.
10.3. Nothing in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions or in any executed OBA shall limit HPL's right to take action as may be required to adjust receipts and deliveries under any Service Agreement to alleviate operating conditions which threaten the operational integrity of the Facilities.
ARTICLE 11. IMBALANCES
11.1. In the event that HPL or Customer delivers or causes to be delivered to a Transporter at the Receipt Point(s) or Delivery Point(s) a quantity of gas not equal to the quantity of gas received or taken by Customer or HPL, a "Transportation Imbalance" may occur. Provided that HPL has taken or delivered the quantity of gas nominated by Customer and scheduled by Transporter, Customer shall be liable for all imbalances under its transportation agreement with such Transporter. Customer agrees to use its best efforts to prevent or diminish any occurrences of imbalances.
11.2. HPL's Right to Balance. Notwithstanding anything in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions to the contrary, HPL may, at any time and from time to time, with notice to Customer, restrict, interrupt or reduce its receipts or deliveries of Gas at the Receipt Point(s) or Delivery Point(s), and direct Customer to make adjustments in its receipts or deliveries, in order to maintain a daily and/or hourly balance or to correct an imbalance. If Customer fails or refuses to follow any such request from HPL, HPL may, without liability hereunder, cease accepting or delivering Gas under this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Customer's Service Agreement until the conditions causing the imbalance are corrected.
11.3. Nothing in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions shall limit HPL's right to take action as may be required to adjust receipts and deliveries under any Service Agreement(s) to alleviate operating conditions which threaten the operational integrity of its Facilities.
ARTICLE 12. MEASUREMENT AND FACILITIES
12.1. Gas received and delivered hereunder shall be measured, treated, injected and redelivered utilizing meters, measuring and telemetry, dehydration, and compression equipment installed, operated and maintained, or caused to be installed, operated and maintained, by HPL or its designee. HPL shall have no obligation to construct or install facilities in order to perform any services requested hereunder.
12.2. The measuring facilities shall be designed, installed, operated and maintained by HPL in accordance with the recommendations contained in the following standards:
Orifice Measurement - American Gas Association Report Number 3, dated 2000 or the latest edition as agreed to by all Parties (herein referred to as AGA 3).
Turbine Measurement - American Gas Association Report Number 7, dated 1996 or the latest edition as agreed to by all Parties (herein referred to as AGA 7).
Positive Measurement - American National Standards Institute B109.2, dated 2000 or the latest edition as agreed to by all Parties (herein referred to as ANSI B109.2).
Ultrasonic Measurement - American Gas Association Report Number 9, dated 2003 or the latest edition as agreed to by all Parties (herein referred to as AGA 9).
12.3. The measuring facilities to measure the volumes of Gas delivered at each of the Receipt Point(s) and Delivery Point(s) shall be maintained and operated by HPL or its designee.
12.4. All meters will be calibrated and or proven on a pre-determined schedule. Notification of scheduled calibrations shall be made to all interested parties and reasonable effort will be made to accommodate each Party's schedule; however, calibration will proceed at the scheduled time regardless of attendees. Records from all measuring equipment are the property of the Metering Party who will keep all such records on file for a period of not less than two years. Upon request, the Metering Party will make available to the Non-Metering Party volume records from the measuring equipment, together with calculations there from, for inspection and verification, subject to return within 30 Days after receipt thereof.
12.5. Either Party shall have the right to conduct such pulsation tests as they deem prudent, at their sole risk and expense. If excessive pulsation is evident, mutually agreed modifications to operation or facility design will be made to reduce the effect of such pulsation. If pulsation issues cannot be resolved in a mutually agreeable manner, either Party shall have the right to refuse delivery or receipt of Gas at the Receipt Point(s) or Delivery Point(s).
12.6. If a measurement device is found to be registering in error by an amount resulting in a volume correction greater than one percent (1%), then the volume shall be corrected at the amount of such inaccuracy for any period which is definitely known or agreed upon. In the event the period is not definitely known or agreed upon, such correction shall be for a period extending back one-half (1/2) of the time elapsed since the date of the last calibration. Following any test, any measurement device found inaccurate shall be immediately restored by HPL as closely as possible to a condition of accuracy. If any measurement device is out of service or out of repair for any reason so that the amount of Gas delivered cannot be estimated or computed, the amount of Gas delivered through such meter during the period such meter is out of service or out of repair shall be estimated and agreed upon by HPL and Customer upon the basis of the best data available using the first of the following methods which is feasible:
a. by using the registration of any check meters if installed and accurately registering;
b. by correcting the error if the percentage of error is ascertainable by calibration, test or mathematical calculation; or
c. by estimating the quantity of deliveries by comparison with deliveries during preceding periods under similar conditions when the meter was registering accurately.
12.7. Units of measurement shall be determined in dekatherms (Dth) derived from the calculation of gas volume (Mcf) and gas heating value (Btu/ft3), both at identical base conditions of temperature and pressure. The unit of volume of Gas shall be one (1) standard cubic foot at an absolute pressure of fourteen and sixty-five hundredths pounds per square inch absolute (14.65 Psia) and at a temperature of sixty degrees Fahrenheit (60?F).
12.8. Atmospheric pressure shall be assumed to be the pressure value as reasonably determined by HPL for the county in which each of the Receipt Point(s) and Delivery Point is located pursuant to generally accepted industry practices, but not less than twelve and nine-tenths (12.9) Psia nor more than fourteen and seven-tenths (14.7) Psia irrespective of the actual atmospheric pressure at such points from time to time.
12.9. All metered volumes shall be computed in accordance with the recommendations contained in the following standards:
Orifice Measurement - American Gas Association Report Number 3, dated 2000 or the latest edition as agreed to by all Parties (herein referred to as AGA 3).
Turbine Measurement - American Gas Association Report Number 7, dated 1996 or the latest edition as agreed to by all Parties (herein referred to as AGA 7).
Positive Measurement - American National Standards Institute B109.2, dated 2000 or the latest edition as agreed to by all Parties (herein referred to as ANSI B109.2).
Ultrasonic Measurement - American Gas Association Report Number 9, dated 2003 or the latest edition as agreed to by all Parties (herein referred to as AGA 9).
12.10. HPL or its designee shall sample and determine the Gross Heating Value, Relative Density and Compressibility received at the Receipt Point(s) or Delivery Point(s) utilizing the following standards:
a. Gas Processors Association (GPA) 2166 - Obtaining Natural Gas Samples for Analysis by Gas.
b. Gas Processors Association (GPA) 2261 - Analysis for Natural Gas and Similar Gaseous Mixtures by Gas Chromatography.
c. Gas Processors Association (GPA) 2145 - Physical Constants for Paraffin Hydrocarbons and Other Components of Natural Gas.
d. Gas Processors Association (GPA) 2172 - Calculation of Gross Heating Value, Relative Density, and Compressibility of Natural Gas Mixtures from Compositional Analysis.
12.11. HPL shall sample the flowing gas stream utilizing one of the following methods:
a. On-line Chromatography
b. Accumulated Sample - If this method is utilized the application of gas quality in the volume calculation will be during the time period the gas sample was accumulated.
c. Spot Sample - If this method is utilized the application of gas quality in the volume calculation will be the time period beginning on the date the sample was obtained until the next sample is obtained.
ARTICLE 13. QUALITY
13.1. Customer agrees that all Gas delivered to HPL at the Receipt Point(s) hereunder shall be merchantable Gas which shall meet the highest standard quality specifications of any pipeline to or from which such Gas is nominated, but at a minimum shall meet the specifications provided in Sections 13.1 and 13.2 below; and HPL agrees that all Gas delivered at the Delivery Point(s) shall meet the following specifications:
(a) Have a total heating value of not less than nine hundred fifty (950) British Thermal Units per cubic foot nor more than one thousand and fifty (1050) British Thermal Units per cubic foot;
(b) Be commercially free of dust, gum, gum-forming constituents, gasoline, liquid hydrocarbons, water, and any other substance of any kind that may become separated from the Gas during the handling thereof or that may cause injury to or interference with proper operation of the lines, meters, regulators, or other appliances through which it flows;
(c) Not contain more than two (2) grains of total sulfur nor more than one-fourth (1/4) grain of hydrogen sulfide per one hundred (100) standard cubic foot;
(d) Not contain more than two percent (2%) by volume of carbon dioxide, two-tenths of one percent (0.2%) by volume of oxygen, nor contain more than three percent (3%) by volume of total inert gases;
(e) Have a temperature of not more than one hundred twenty degrees Fahrenheit (120?F) nor less than forty degrees Fahrenheit (40?F); and
(f) Not contain more than seven (7) pounds of water vapor per one million (1,000,000) standard cubic feet.
13.2. Additionally, all Gas being received at the Receipt Point(s)s shall have a hydrocarbon dew point below forty degrees Fahrenheit (40?F).
13.3. In the event that the Gas being received does not conform to the standards outlined above, HPL reserves the right to restrict or refuse any volumes that are non-conforming or deficient.
13.4. Customer shall be responsible for odorizing any part of the Gas delivered hereunder at the Delivery Point(s) which is diverted and/or used for any purpose for which odorization is required pursuant to regulations of the Texas Railroad Commission.
13.5. Notwithstanding the foregoing, HPL expressly reserves the right, at any time in the future, upon prior written notice to Customer, to institute new, quality specifications or revise from time to time the quality specifications set forth above. Upon such modification of any such quality specifications by HPL, Customer will have the right to terminate the Service Agreement and all applicable Service Agreement on the effective date of the modification by giving prior written notice to HPL. If accepted by Customer, upon the effective date, such new quality specifications will supersede and replace the quality specifications set forth above.
ARTICLE 14. TITLE TO GAS, POSSESSION, CONTROL, WARRANTIES
14.1. Title to and ownership of Customer's Gas shall at all times be and remain with Customer. CUSTOMER REPRESENTS AND WARRANTS TO HPL THAT CUSTOMER HAS FULL AND UNQUALIFIED TITLE TO ALL GAS DELIVERED TO HPL HEREUNDER, THAT CUSTOMER HAS THE AUTHORITY TO DELIVER SUCH GAS TO HPL, THAT SUCH GAS IS FREE FROM ANY AND ALL LIENS, CHARGES, ADVERSE CLAIMS AND ENCUMBRANCES AND THAT CUSTOMER SHALL FULLY INDEMNIFY, DEFEND, PROTECT, AND SAVE HPL AND ITS AFFILIATES HARMLESS FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL SUITS, ACTIONS (INCLUDING ANY INTERPLEADER OR DECLARATORY ACTION NECESSITATED BY ANY SUCH ADVERSE CLAIM), CLAIMS, DEMANDS, DAMAGES, COSTS (INCLUDING COURT COSTS AND REASONABLE ATTORNEYS' FEES), LOSSES AND EXPENSES ARISING FROM OR OUT OF ANY ADVERSE CLAIMS TO OR AGAINST SUCH GAS OR ANY INTEREST THEREIN OR IN THE VALUE THEREOF.
14.2. HPL WARRANTS THAT THE THERMALLY EQUIVALENT QUANTITIES OF GAS DELIVERED HEREUNDER TO CUSTOMER SHALL BE FREE FROM ALL LIENS AND ADVERSE CLAIMS ARISING BY, THROUGH, OR UNDER HPL, AND IT WILL FULLY INDEMNIFY, DEFEND, PROTECT, AND SAVE CUSTOMER HARMLESS FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL SUITS, ACTIONS (INCLUDING ANY INTERPLEADER OR DECLARATORY ACTIONS NECESSITATED BY AN ADVERSE CLAIM), LOSSES AND EXPENSES ARISING DIRECTLY FROM SAME.
14.3. Customer shall be deemed to be in control and in possession of the Gas prior to such Gas being received by HPL and after redelivery by HPL to Customer at the Delivery Point(s), and shall indemnify and hold HPL harmless from any damages, losses or injuries caused thereby. HPL shall be in control and in possession of the Gas after receipt of same for injection at the Receipt Point(s) and until redelivery by HPL to Customer at the Delivery Point(s), and shall indemnify and hold Customer harmless from any damages, losses or injuries caused thereby, except for injuries and damages that have been occasioned proximately by the negligence of Customer or its designee.
14.4. The risk of loss for all Gas injected into, stored in, and withdrawn from the Facilities shall be and remain with Customer, and HPL shall not be liable to Customer for any loss of gas, except as may be occasioned due to the intentional or grossly negligent acts or omissions by HPL. Any losses of gas, unless due to the intentional or grossly negligent acts or omissions of HPL shall be shared proportionally by all customers, based on each customer's gas storage inventory in relation to the total gas storage inventory on the day of the loss. EXCEPT AS PROVIDED ABOVE, THE PARTY IN CONTROL AND POSSESSION OF THE GAS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR AND SHALL INDEMNIFY AND HOLD THE OTHER PARTY HARMLESS WITH RESPECT TO ANY LOSSES, INJURIES, CLAIMS, LIABILITIES OR DAMAGES CAUSED THEREBY OR ON ACCOUNT OF TAXES, PAYMENTS OR OTHER CHARGES APPLICABLE AND OCCURRING WHILE THE GAS IS IN ITS POSSESSION. EACH PARTY HERETO COVENANTS THAT WITH RESPECT TO THE GAS DELIVERED OR REDELIVERED BY IT HEREUNDER, IT WILL INDEMNIFY AND SAVE THE OTHER PARTY HARMLESS FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL SUITS, ACTIONS, CAUSES OF ACTION, CLAIMS AND DEMANDS ARISING FROM OR OUT OF ANY ADVERSE CLAIMS BY THIRD PARTIES CLAIMING OWNERSHIP OF OR AN INTEREST IN THE GAS SO DELIVERED OR REDELIVERED. Subject to the other terms and conditions of this Statement of Operating Conditions and the Service Agreement, each Party has the right to treat, process, and/or dehydrate the Gas prior to delivering said Gas to the other Party.
14.5. Insurance. Customer shall be responsible for providing its own insurance coverage with respect to its Gas in the Storage Facility.
ARTICLE 15. BILLING AND PAYMENT
15.1. On or before the 15th Day of each Month, HPL shall render to Customer a statement for the preceding Month properly identifying the specific services rendered by HPL on behalf of Customer, the amount due therefor, and the amount of Customer's Gas held in or loaned from the Facilities as of the close of such Month, if applicable. If actual quantities are not known at the time of billing, then billing shall be based upon confirmed nominations, subject to adjustments when actual quantities are available.
15.2. Customer shall pay HPL the full amount reflected on the statement rendered within ten (10) Days after the invoice statement date. If the 10th Day falls upon a weekend or legal holiday, then such payment shall be made on the last regular Business Day prior to the 10th Day. Customer shall make such payment by wire transfer, pursuant to the instructions set forth in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions. In the event that Customer fails to pay such amounts when due, interest shall accrue on all unpaid amounts from the date due until paid at a rate of interest equal to the lesser of: (i) the then effective prime rate of interest charged by the Citibank, N.A., New York, New York or its successor plus two percent (2%) per annum; or (ii) the maximum applicable lawful interest rate.
15.3. If Customer, in good faith, disputes the amount of any such statement or any part thereof, Customer shall pay to HPL such amount as it concedes to be correct. In addition, HPL shall have the right, at its sole discretion, to require Customer to provide sufficient security in a form satisfactory to HPL to guarantee the unpaid balance and one hundred eighty (180) Days of interest on the unpaid balance, calculated as described in Article 15.2. HPL agrees not to terminate the Customer's Service Agreement or suspend deliveries and/or receipts of Gas because of nonpayment unless the Customer ends or does not extend or increase the security as reasonably requested by HPL. Additionally, within ten (10) Business Days of Customer's payment of less than the total amounts invoiced by HPL, Customer shall provide to HPL documentation detailing the amount being disputed and Customer's reasons therefore. Upon resolution of the disputed amount, any moneys due and payable to HPL shall be paid within ten (10) Days and shall include interest as described in Article 15.2 above.
15.4. Each Party shall have the right, at its own expense, upon reasonable notice and at reasonable times, to receive verification of the accuracy of any statement, payment, demand, charge or computation made under this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and/or Service Agreement. Provided, however, that any such audit and any claim based upon errors in any statement, etc., must be made within two (2) years after the date of such statement; otherwise, any statement shall be final as to all Parties unless questioned within two (2) years.
15.5. If Customer fails to pay any amount invoiced hereunder (other than amounts disputed in good faith, as provided in Article 15.3), then HPL shall have the right to terminate or suspend service to Customer in accordance with this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions. Such termination shall not prejudice HPL's right to recover from Customer such past due amounts, together with interest as provided above, nor HPL's right to recover and Customer's obligation to provide any Gas due HPL from Customer.
15.6. If any invoiced amount remains unpaid after the due date thereof, in addition to any other rights that HPL may have under the Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Service Agreement or at law or in equity, HPL shall have the right, upon giving Customer written notice, to suspend injections and/or withdrawals under any or all Agreements and/or terminate all Agreements. Customer, by its nonpayment in full of all amounts then due within two (2) Days after such notice, shall be deemed to have consented to any and all such suspensions and/or such terminations. Suspension of injections and/or withdrawals under an Agreement will not relieve Customer of liability for capacity charges and deliverability charges which accrue after any such suspension.
15.7. HPL will not suspend injections and/or withdrawals or terminate Agreements as provided in subsection 15.6 above if Customer disputes an invoiced amount in good faith and furnishes to HPL, within two (2) Days after HPL's termination/suspension notice, (i) prompt notice of the basis for Customer's dispute as set forth in Section 15.3 above, and (ii) a surety bond or other form of security in an amount and with a surety satisfactory to HPL, in HPL's sole but reasonable discretion, guaranteeing payment of the disputed amount ultimately found properly due to HPL.
ARTICLE 16. SECURITY AND RIGHT OF SET-OFF
16.1. HPL shall have the right to satisfy any and all amounts due and payable to HPL in a manner consistent with applicable law, including, without limitation, by asserting and enforcing its rights under all applicable liens and security interests held by HPL in Customer's Gas.
16.2. HPL will not be obligated to provide service and may suspend and/or terminate ongoing service to any Customer or Potential Customer that fails, in HPL's sole judgment, to demonstrate Creditworthiness.
16.3. If at any time Customer or Potential Customer (as applicable) fails to demonstrate Creditworthiness, or if the aggregate amounts expected to become due for services requested by Customer under existing and/or requested Service Agreements, together with any other amounts then owed by Customer to HPL, exceed Customer's credit limit as established by HPL, HPL shall be entitled to require (in addition to all liens and security interests already claimed by or granted in favor of HPL, as a condition of providing or continuing to provide services under new or existing Service Agreement, that such Customer or Potential Customer (as applicable) provide one or more of the following forms of "Performance Assurance" in an amount and for a term determined solely by HPL:"
(a) Post an irrevocable standby letter of credit in a form and from a bank satisfactory to Transporter for services; or (b) Provide a prepayment or a deposit for services via wire transfer in immediately available funds or; (c) grant of a first priority security interest in collateral satisfactory to HPL.
16.4 Should Customer fail to provide Performance Assurance(s) to HPL within two (2) Business Days after receipt of written demand for such assurance, then HPL shall have the right to suspend performance under the Statement of Operating Terms and Condition and any or all applicable Service Agreement(s) until such time as Customer furnishes Performance Assurance(s). If such assurance is not provided by Customer within ten (10) Business Days from written demand, HPL may terminate Customer's Service Agreement(s) in addition to having any and all other remedies available hereunder.
16.5. HPL will not be required to perform or continue to perform service under any Service Agreement in the event: (i) Customer has voluntarily filed for bankruptcy protection under any chapter of the Bankruptcy Code; (ii) Customer is the subject of an involuntary petition of bankruptcy under any chapter of the Bankruptcy Code, and such involuntary petition has not been settled or otherwise dismissed within 90 Days of such filing; or (iii) Customer otherwise becomes insolvent, whether by an inability to meet its debts as they come due in the ordinary course of business or because its liabilities exceed its assets on a balance sheet test; and/or however such insolvency may otherwise be evidenced.
16.6. If Customer fails to pay in full any amount owing to HPL under the Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Service Agreement(s) within five (5) Days after such amount became due, then, in addition to all other remedies available to it under this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and Service Agreement(s), at law, in equity or otherwise, HPL may set off the overdue amount against amounts otherwise owing by HPL to Customer under the Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions and the Service Agreement(s) or any other agreement between the Parties.
ARTICLE 17. CORRESPONDENCE
17.1. Except as otherwise provided herein, any notice, request, invoice or statement provided in this Statement of Operating Terms and Conditions or the Service Agreement(s) between Customer and HPL shall be in writing, and may be transmitted via ordinary mail or fax as specified below.
